TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CssStyleCollection extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains the HTML cascading-style sheets (CSS) inline style attributes for a specified HTML server control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Any style declared for a particular HTML server control is added to the collection when the containing Web Forms page is parsed. It automatically parses and exposes CSS properties through a dictionary pattern API. You can manipulate any CSS property on a server control through the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Style%2A> property. Simply use the CSS property's key and value in the indexed collection.
## Examples The following code example iterates through the CssStyleCollection object for an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputText> server control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Keys%2A> property is used to determine which style attributes have been declared on the server control, and then binds the attribute names and values to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> object on the Web Forms page.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.cssstyle_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.cssstyle_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (string key, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(string key, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the new style attribute to add to the collection.
The value of the style attribute to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a style item to the of a control using the specified name/value pair.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the style item to add exists in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration, use the overload of the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method that takes an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> parameter because it is strongly typed. This means that items that are added will be included when viewing items with the get accessor of the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Item%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use both overloads of the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method to add a cascading style sheet to an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputSubmit>, and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control programmatically.
[!code-vb[Classic CssStyleCollection.Add Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.cssstyle_2_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic CssStyleCollection.Add Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.cssstyle_2_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle key, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(valuetype System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle key, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The enumeration value to add to the collection.
The value of the style attribute to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a style item to the collection of a control using the specified enumeration value and corresponding value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the style item to add exists in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration, use this Add overload of the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method rather than the overload that does not take an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> parameter.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use both overloads of the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method to add a cascading style sheet to an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputSubmit>, and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control programmatically.
[!code-vb[Classic CssStyleCollection.Add Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/d509fd6a-fe09-4b02-8ed1-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic CssStyleCollection.Add Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/d509fd6a-fe09-4b02-8ed1-_1.aspx)]

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified CSS value for the HTML server control.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Item%2A> property to return the value of a style that is set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputText> control.
[!code-vb[Classic CssStyleCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_1_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic CssStyleCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_1_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public string this[System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle key] { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified value for the HTML server control.
Docs.value: The value ; otherwise, , if is not in the server control's collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Style items that are added programmatically to a <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection> collection for a control with the Item property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method that take an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration value as an input are included in the count of style items that are returned with the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Count%2A> property and are included with the string literal that is returned with the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Value%2A> property. These attributes are strongly typed. If the cascading style sheet attribute that you want to add to a server control exists in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration, use these strongly typed methods. If the attribute you want to add does not exist in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Item%2A> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method.
Trying to access an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration value in the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection> of a control that has not been added or to access a CSS attribute that has been added with the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Item%2A> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Add%2A> method, returns `null` using the Item property.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection.Item%2A> property to return the value of a style that is set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputText> control.
[!code-vb[Classic CssStyleCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_3_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic CssStyleCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_3_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of keys to all the styles in the object for a specific HTML server control.
Docs.value: A collection of keys contained in the for the specified HTML server control.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection> collection for an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputText> server control. The Keys property is used to determine which style attribute has been declared on the server control and binds the attribute names and values to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> object on the Web Forms page.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_2_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.cssstyle_2_1.aspx)]

Gets or sets the value of the attribute of the HTML server control.

remarks.format:
